categories.name: Reputation
categories.notes: Vendor Profile with scusa and other business. Analysts Review based on maturity and success

requirements.name: concurrent editing
notes: Ability for multiple users to work within the same data stream to enter information and work a task
handling of concurrent saving issues
warnings that someone else is looking at the 'editable'
locking, to prevent clashes

requirements.name: ad hoc
notes: this solution is designed specifically for the problem we are facing

requirements.name: automatic reporting
notes: on a schedule
without human intervention
set it and forget it

requirements.name: data wrangling
notes: Aggregate disparate data in a single application
has built in techniques for formatting data. (like normalizing metric and customary measurements)
accepts all data

requirements.name: alerts
notes: time/deadline based
event driven alerting
email support
select targets

requirements.name: validation
notes: Clear and accurate data input validation
difficult to break system due to user interaction
is UI hardened to prevent silly user actions

requirements.name: spend tracking
notes: receipt and tracking
Spend management capture
spend by month, quarter, year
granular level tracking mechanism in order to track litigation costs

requirements.name: state machine
notes: Create and update status
ex. (discovery, trial, etc)
move objects or processes along with simple status changes

requirements.name: schema
notes: Master metadata management
we can define custom metadata
we can easily change metadata schema

requirements.name: tagging
notes: Ability to tag and label data is it comes in
attach misc text notes to a object, process, event, or document
assign key value pairs on the fly to aforementioned without predefined schema

requirements.name: workflows
notes: Workflow group re-assignment
Ex. Association of matters back to other groups like complaints
support for custom designed business processes

requirements.name: custom objects
notes: logical separation of types
ex. complaints, subpoenas, litigation
create entity with rules and/or properties
high level visual programming flexibility

requirements.name: searching
notes: dynamic Search
faceted search
search by any field/property/column
ex. Search by primary key like acct number

requirements.name: reporting
notes: Robust reporting mechanism
Reporting dashboard customized by user
simple interface for report view customization
standard SQL language aggregation

requirements.name: external connectors
notes: Original Metadata integration into third party systems
ex. Tie into catalyst and create detail so that when it goes to catalyst the case system still has all the original meta data
supported 3rd party integrations to other CRM/ECM/BPM platforms

requirements.name: outlook
notes: outlook integration
ex. Scrape data from email and automatically insert into a case

requirements.name: events
notes: Integration into real time eventing systems
Ex. Cases created from real time fraud events
trigger events with API call
flexible event trigger mechanisms such as file drop, email, api post, or 3rd party event

requirements.name: lifecycle
notes: provide full lifecycle support for the business process?

requirements.name: configuration
notes: Does it ship with accelerators that speed the configuration process?

requirements.name: UI
notes: Does it support various relevant views out of the box?

requirements.name: Testing
notes: Does it support simulation
test or pre-prod validation environments?

requirements.name: NOC
notes: Does it provide monitoring and alerting?

requirements.name: out-of-box
notes: Does it provide relevant out-of-the-box construct for business components?

requirements.name: clarity
notes: Does the tool provide business process guidance—e.g., process map, or workflow?

requirements.name: help
notes: Does the tool provide context-sensitive, help?

requirements.name: documentation
notes: Does it provide relevant out-of-the-box templates or patterns for constructs, which can be used to jump start business projects?

requirements.name: modeling
notes: Does it support visual modelling
drag-and-drop and linking through connecting lines?
Can business components be easily viewed, used, and re-used?
Does it provide a way for consistently naming, versioning, organizing, and managing the business components?

requirements.name: collaboration
notes: Does it support distributed, enterprise use—e.g., multi-user collaboration support?

requirements.name: versioning
notes: Is use of programmatic languages within company guidelines? Does it include version control?

requirements.name: localization
notes: Does the tool support globalization and/or localization?

requirements.name: web client
notes: Is it accessible through a web browser?

requirements.name: LDAP
notes: Does the tool provide LDAP-based user authentication?

requirements.name: roles
notes: Does it support role-based authorization?
Does it provide an approval workflow for separation of duties

requirements.name: audit
notes: Robust audit monitoring piece
Does it track and audit changes to the configuration and data?
Time based business activity monitory
Rules based identification and alerting

requirements.name: storage
notes: Does it handle sensitive data?
NPPI file and data storage
Potentially PCI

requirements.name: PEN test
notes: Does it pass vulnerability assessments

requirements.name: isolation
notes: can separate data, and departments from each other
not shared space with other companies

requirements.name: granularity
notes: Need to be able to configure access by role as far down as a field level

requirements.name: capacity
notes: Do the tool capacity constraints meet expectation of business need?  Size of data, Number of files, Number of data entries/records?

requirements.name: administration
notes: Does the tool provide easy-to-use mechanisms to perform administrative tasks—e.g. manage users/roles, run troubleshooting reports, run audit reports, etc?

requirements.name: dev ops
notes: Does it provide ways to perform administrative tasks to the infrastructure stack?

requirements.name: database
notes: Does the tool function with multiple industry standard data stores?
Oracle, SQL Server, MySql, Sqlite, NoSql, etc
is storage proprietary? (bad)

requirements.name: inter-compatible
notes: Are newer versions of the tool backwards-compatible?
does changing versions require any effort
version up
rollback version

requirements.name: centralized
notes: Does it allow integration and consolidation of data into a central location?
all accessible with one portal/IP/interface/SDK
not necessarily same physical location. more like logically centralized

requirements.name: file size
notes: average file size for a document is 6 mb
other items can do as much as 4 to 8 mb per email
efficient data store techniques

requirements.name: retention
notes: document retention and management
Storage is needed for 7 to 10 years
compression?
time to revive old files

requirements.name: migration
notes: Data migration from Current System ex. Sharepoint - integrate data from sharepoint and isight back between 3 and 5 years
is the data trapped inside? Can we get it back out in a standard format?
can the solution accept standard data as input?

requirements.name: scale-able
notes: Is the platform scaleable?
is there downtime to scale out?
can we scale down?
horizontal scaling?

requirements.name: custom export
notes: Can it create information within the tool export them to other commonly used tools, and have the users of those tools use the information intact?
excel
json
xml

requirements.name: custom import
notes: Can it import Information created in other tools, and use the information intact?
excel
json
xml

requirements.name: batching
notes: Does it integrate with other tools via service or batch?
for optimized batch uploading/downloading
optimized processing large volumes of data

requirements.name: REST
notes: Does it provide and support industry standard API’s?
only SOAP (bad)
is RESTFUL?

requirements.name: standardized
notes: Does it use relevant industry standards in configurations/codebase
JSON
HTML
css

requirements.name: extensible
notes: Can the tool itself be extended or customized? How so?
how difficult is it to extend?

requirements.name: licensing model
notes: Do the available licensing models meet business expectations?
SaaS, Internal, Iaas, Paas, per seat, per cpu, per core
are we being gouged with hidden costs?

requirements.name: fairness
notes: Do the pricing schemes meet the business expectations? One time plus maintenance, monthly, yearly
is the price clear? Or is it hidden behind a conversation wall?

requirements.name: training
notes: Does a training program exist that meets expectation?
Is completed in a timely manner?

requirements.name: overhead
notes: Do the necessary skill sets and number of resources required to keep the tool operational and up-to-date meet expectation?
How many people will it take to manage this new system?
are we forced to outsource experts to solve problems?

requirements.name: certifications
notes: Has the tool been certified under any governing body within the business domain?
SSAE 16, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, ISO 9001, SOC

requirements.name: in use
notes: Existing relationship with SC
Existing relationship with SHUSA

requirements.name: contacts
notes: Can the vendor supply reference contacts for business relevant customers
do other real people use this as a solution

requirements.name: specialty
notes: Is this the vendor's core competency?
Does the vendor provide business and technology relevant professional services?

requirements.name: community
notes: Is third-party support for the tool available?
forum community

requirements.name: IT critics
notes: Outside IT analysis quantification?
Gartner, Forrester

requirements.name: Business critics
notes: Outside Business Analysis quantification? (Business specific identified leader in ranking the feature)
